meanings.sent1: He runs to catch the bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: The dog runs happily in the park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel runs around the tree in a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: Time runs like a river, never stopping.
meanings.sent5: The wind runs through the fields, carrying whispers of stories.

meanings.definition: A period of time in which a particular activity or operation is carried out
meanings.sent1: The bakery has early morning runs to prepare fresh bread.
meanings.sent2: During the school runs, traffic can be heavy.
meanings.sent3: The runs of the washing machine seem never-ending on laundry day.
meanings.sent4: The runs of the play rehearsals kept everyone busy.
meanings.sent5: The runs of the factory were smooth and efficient.

meanings.definition: A sequence of cards in a card game
meanings.sent1: She had a good hand with three runs in the game.
meanings.sent2: The runs in poker can lead to exciting wins.
meanings.sent3: The runs of cards in solitaire can be tricky to complete.
meanings.sent4: His runs in the card game were unmatched by anyone.
meanings.sent5: The runs in the deck made the game more challenging.

meanings.definition: A flow or discharge of liquid or gas
meanings.sent1: The water runs clear from the mountain stream.
meanings.sent2: The runs of gas from the stove were concerning.
meanings.sent3: The runs of rainwater down the window created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent4: The runs of lava from the volcano were dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The runs of ink from the pen formed beautiful patterns on the paper.

meanings.definition: A series of successes or failures in a particular activity
meanings.sent1: Her recent runs in business have been profitable.
meanings.sent2: The team had a good run of successful runs in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The runs of luck in the game turned in his favor.
meanings.sent4: The runs of failures taught him valuable lessons.
meanings.sent5: The runs of achievements motivated them to aim higher.
